intro: Pterichis andrei, commonly known as the Andean pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and moderate rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
